t: Habakkuk 2
God Answers the Prophet
I*pn will stand on my guard post And*ln station myself on the rampart; And*ln I will keep watch to see what He will speak to me, And*ln how I may reply when I am reproved.
Then*ln the Lord*s answered me and said, “Record*ln the vision And*ln inscribe it*i on tablets, That*ln the one who reads it may run.
For*ln the vision is yet for the appointed time; It*ln hastens toward the goal and it will not fail. Though*ln it tarries, wait for it; For*ln it will certainly come, it will not delay.
“Behold,*ln as for the proud one, His*ln soul is not right within him; But*ln the righteous will live by his faith.

Furthermore,*ln wine betrays the haughty man, So*ln that he does not stay at home. He*ln enlarges his appetite like Sheol, And*ln he is like death, never satisfied. He*ln also gathers to himself all nations And*ln collects to himself all peoples.

“Will*ln not all of these take up a taunt-song against him, Even*ln mockery and*i insinuations against him And*ln say, ‘Woe to him who increases what is not his— For*ln how long— And*ln makes himself rich with loans?’
Will*ln not your creditors rise up suddenly, And*ln those who collect from you awaken? Indeed,*ln you will become plunder for them.
Because*ln you have looted many nations, All*ln the remainder of the peoples will loot you— Because*ln of human bloodshed and violence done to the land, To*ln the town and all its inhabitants.
“Woe*ln to him who gets evil gain for his house To*ln put his nest on high, To*ln be delivered from the hand of calamity!
You*ln have devised a shameful thing for your house By*ln cutting off many peoples; So*ln you are sinning against yourself.
Surely*ln the stone will cry out from the wall, And*ln the rafter will answer it from the framework.
“Woe*ln to him who builds a city with bloodshed And*ln founds a town with violence!
Is*ln it not indeed from the Lord*s of hosts That*ln peoples toil for fire, And*ln nations grow weary for nothing?
For*ln the earth will be filled With*ln the knowledge of the glory of the Lord,*s As*ln the waters cover the sea.
“Woe*ln to you who make your neighbors drink, Who*ln mix in your venom even to make them*i drunk So*ln as to look on their nakedness!

You*ln will be filled with disgrace rather than honor. Now*ln you yourself drink and expose your own*i nakedness. The*ln cup in the Lord’s*s right hand will come around to you, And*ln utter disgrace will*i come*i upon your glory.

For*ln the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, And*ln the devastation of its*i beasts by which you terrified them, Because*ln of human bloodshed and violence done to the land, To*ln the town and all its inhabitants.
“What*ln profit is the idol when its maker has carved it, Or*iln an image, a teacher of falsehood? For*ln its*i maker trusts in his own*i handiwork When*ln he fashions speechless idols.

Woe*ln to him who says to a piece*i of*i wood, ‘Awake!’ To*ln a mute stone, ‘Arise!’ And*iln that is your*i teacher? Behold,*ln it is overlaid with gold and silver, And*ln there is no breath at all inside it.
But*ln the Lord*s is in His holy temple. Let*ln all the earth be silent before Him.”
